alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 8:10PM CDT until May 07 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Crockett. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...along and south of I-10 near Ft. Lancaster..moving southeast at 15 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Crockett County - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along County Road 208. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
